body_text:
~/.bazelrc will be loaded when building tf_serving or tensorflow, .bazelrc
from tf_serving can import the .bazelrc from tensorflow it should just work.

There is no way to load ~/tf_serving/.bazelrc when building from
~/tf_serving/tensorflow.

As said previously, to make that use case works nicely, it would be better
to write a remote repository that write those configuration in a BUILD file
/ skylark file.

On Wed, Mar 15, 2017 at 1:59 AM Justine Tunney <notifications@github.com> wrote:

@dandelionmane <https://github.com/dandelionmane> I wrote this change under
the assumption that dependent projects might choose to write their own
./configure scripts, that define the .bazelrc in their root directory.

@damienmg <https://github.com/damienmg> How robust can we make Bazel's
.bazelrc discovery? Assume we have three .bazelrc files:

   - ~/.bazelrc
   - ~/tf_serving/.bazelrc
   - ~/tf_serving/tensorflow/.bazelrc

If we build something inside ~/tf_serving/tensorflow/... then should all
three bazelrc's be loaded? And if so, having the latter ones take priority?

—
